title: Vintage Refrigerators
description: From iceboxes to Frigidaire, test your knowledge of how families kept food cold

questions.question: Before electric refrigerators, what did families use to keep food cold, relying on regular deliveries of frozen blocks?
What occupation involved delivering large blocks of ice to homes for use in iceboxes?
Which brand name became so synonymous with refrigerators that many people used it as a generic term for any fridge?
What distinctive feature of 1950s refrigerators required users to pull a heavy chrome handle to open the door?
options: A lever-action handle with a positive latch

questions.question: What safety concern about old refrigerators led to the Refrigerator Safety Act of 1956?
options: Children getting trapped inside abandoned units

questions.question: What popular pastel color were many kitchen refrigerators painted in during the 1950s?
What small freezer compartment inside early single-door refrigerators was barely large enough to hold a few ice cube trays?
What annoying maintenance task did owners of older refrigerators have to perform regularly to prevent ice buildup?
What GE innovation, introduced in the 1960s, eliminated the need to manually defrost a refrigerator?
What color combination dominated kitchen appliances including refrigerators in the 1970s?
What style of refrigerator, with the freezer on top and fridge below, became the standard American design by the 1960s?
What aluminum tray with a lever handle was used to make ice cubes in home freezers before automatic ice makers?
options: A metal ice cube tray with a pull lever

questions.question: What early refrigerant gas, used in the first home refrigerators, was toxic and caused several deaths before being replaced?
What company introduced the first successful home refrigerator, the 'Guardian Frigerator,' which later became Frigidaire?
options: Guardian Frigerator Company (later bought by GM)

questions.question: What did many families display on their refrigerator doors using small magnets, turning the fridge into a family bulletin board?
